alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 22 at 6:23PM CDT until March 22 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN CHOCTAW...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 622 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Gilbertown, or 16 miles south of Butler, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Butler around 640 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
